flag-bit.name: move_state
flag-bit.comment: (CANMOVE) Can the dwarf move or are they waiting for their movement timer

flag-bit.name: inactive
flag-bit.comment: (DEAD) Set for dead units and incoming/leaving critters that are alive but off-map

flag-bit.name: marauder
flag-bit.comment: wide class of invader/inside creature attackers

flag-bit.name: forest
flag-bit.comment: used for units no longer linked to merchant/diplomacy, they just try to leave mostly

flag-bit.name: zombie
flag-bit.comment: (TEMPORARY_FLAG) used as a temporary marker in certain places

flag-bit.name: can_swap
flag-bit.comment: (CANSWAP) Can swap tiles during movement (prevents multiple swaps)

flag-bit.name: on_ground
flag-bit.comment: (GROUNDED) The creature is laying on the floor, can be conscious

flag-bit.name: invader_origin
flag-bit.comment: (INVADER_ORIG) Invader origin (could be inactive and fleeing)

flag-bit.name: coward
flag-bit.comment: (WILLFLEEUNDERLOSSES) Will flee if invasion turns around

flag-bit.name: invades
flag-bit.comment: (INVADERFORAY2) Marauder resident/invader moving in all the way

flag-bit.name: check_flows
flag-bit.comment: (FLOWCHECK) Check against flows next time you get a chance

flag-bit.name: sparring
flag-bit.comment: (PLAYCOMBAT) works, but not set for sparring military dwarves(?) (since 0.40.01?)

flag-bit.name: no_notify
flag-bit.comment: (NO_NOTIFICATIONS) Do not notify about level gains (for embark etc)

flag-bit.name: uniquebody
flag-bit.comment: this unit has a unique body plan which will be stored in and loaded from the savefile individually

flag-bit.name: killed
flag-bit.comment: (HAS_BEEN_KILLED) Has been killed by kill function (slightly different from dead, not necessarily violent death)

flag-bit.name: cleanup_1
flag-bit.comment: (MUST_FORGET_COMPLETELY) Must be forgotten by forget function (just cleanup)

flag-bit.name: locked_in_for_trading
flag-bit.comment: (TRADE_LOCKED) Locked in for trading (it's a projectile on the other set of flags, might be what the flying was)

flag-bit.name: cleanup_4
flag-bit.comment: (NONGLOBAL_DELETE) Marked for special cleanup as unused load from unit block on disk

flag-bit.name: stuck_weapon_computed
flag-bit.comment: (STUCKIN_WOULD_FLAGS_CALCULATED) cleared if removing StuckIn item to recompute wound flags.

flag-bit.name: compute_health
flag-bit.comment: (WOUND_CHECK_REQUIRED) causes the health structure to be created or updated

flag-bit.name: announce_titan
flag-bit.comment: *(UNANNOUNCED) Announces creature like an FB or titan.

flag-bit.name: body_temp_in_range
flag-bit.comment: (BP_TEMP_CHECK_OFF) Is set to 1 every tick for non-dead creatures.

flag-bit.name: wait_until_reveal
flag-bit.comment: (FROZEN_IN_TIME) Blocks all kind of things until tile is revealed.

flag-bit.name: scuttle
flag-bit.comment: (IS_EQUIPMENT) Scuttle creature: causes creature to be killed, leaving a behind corpse and generating negative thoughts like a real kill.

flag-bit.name: guest
flag-bit.comment: causes No Activity to be displayed

flag-bit.name: enabled
flag-bit.comment: by itself is everybody does this, enabled|limited is only selected

flag-bit.name: limited
flag-bit.comment: by itself is nobody does this

enum-attr.name: short_name
enum-attr.comment: Goal name in up to 20 characters for displaying in fixed width column

enum-attr.name: achieved_short_name
enum-attr.comment: Achieved goal name in up to 20 characters for displaying in fixed width column

enum-item.name: WildUntamed
enum-item.comment: Seems to be used as default when not flags1.tame

data-definition.enum-type:
Dwarf Fortress calls the functions that use this type to determine the pronouns for abstract_building, so it's not anything biology-related.
using C-style escapes here as XML doesn't like having characters 11 and 12 in it, even if they're escaped this currently works fine due to how the headers are generated, but a different solution may be needed if the header generator is more robust in the future
data-definition.class-type:
(describe-obj $.name) (awhen (find-creature $.race) (fmt "~:(~A ~A~)" $it.caste[$.caste].caste_id $it.creature_id))
E.g. for a dead miner, holds the place where he was likely hanging around when he got the command to mine in an aquifer.
This was used by a vampire scared of cave creatures and doing FleeFromOpponent panic

enum.name: type2
enum.comment: seems to have same value as type

enum-item.name: Pet
enum-item.comment: Left shoulder, right shoulder, or head, selected randomly using pet_seed

int32_t.name: improve_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES improve cost; then value++

int32_t.name: unused_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES unused rate; then rust_counter++

int32_t.name: rust_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES rust; then demotion_counter++

int32_t.name: demotion_counter
int32_t.comment: counts to PHYS_ATT_RATES demotion; then value--; soft_demotion++

struct-type.bitfield:
cause rq_diagnosis:
prevent rq_diagnosis or needs_healthcare:

stl-vector.name: parts
stl-vector.pointer:
Contact area of the wound. Is initially the lesser of the weapon or body part contact areas. It grows with cumulative hits. Body parts and non-weapon items have contact=(size/10)^(2/3).
This is strain. For skin/muscle/fat it is usually around 50000, and for bone 100-113. This number heals over time towards 0. A wound that only has strain is called "dented".
A random percentage from 0-100, only for edged damage cases. Otherwise 0. Values above 50 turn straight_scar description into curving scar.
exact location unknown:
This 0-100 percentage is related to cumulative damage. In cases where multiple axe hacks are necessary for severing a limb, it must reach 100 before severing occurs. In cases where a weapon can't completely penetrate a tissue, it is related to the weapon's penetration number. This percentage heals towards 0 over time.

data-definition.enum-type:
for thirsty patients for hungry patients
handled manually
data-definition.bitfield-type: due to a field initialization bug, higher bits contain garbage

flag-bit.name: needs_bandage
flag-bit.comment: used to remove once not needed

flag-bit.name: needs_cast
flag-bit.comment: used to remove once not needed

int32_t.name: time_without_distress
int32_t.comment: range 0-806400, higher values cause stress to decrease quicker

int32_t.name: time_without_eustress
int32_t.comment: range 0-806400, higher values cause stress to increase quicker

int32_t.name: outdoor_dislike_counter
int32_t.comment: incremented when unit is in rain

int32_t.name: focus_level
int32_t.comment: goes to 400 when unit satisfies need

int32_t.name: need_level
int32_t.comment: how fast focus_level decreases when it below 0

flag-bit.name: has_unmet_needs
flag-bit.comment: focus_level is below -999 for at least one need

pointer.name: temporary_trait_changes
pointer.comment: sum of inebriation or so personality changing effects

int32_t.name: undistracted_focus
int32_t.comment: usually number of needs multiplied by 4

enum-type.comment: for the action timer API, not in DF

int32_t.name: natural_skill_lvl
int32_t.comment: This is the NATURAL_SKILL level for the caste in the raws. This skill cannot rust below this level.

uint32_t.name: prefstring_seed
uint32_t.comment: feeds into a simple RNG to choose which prefstring to use

flag-bit.name: enabled
flag-bit.comment: by itself is everybody does this, enabled|limited is only selected

flag-bit.name: limited
flag-bit.comment: by itself is nobody does this

int32_t.comment: always 0 when loading a save, complete nonsense in a save?
